sharedText.mainHeader: Copy of your jury summons reply
sharedText.logoAlt: Logo for Her Majesty's Courts and Tribunals Service
sharedText.confirmDate: I can do jury service on the date shown
sharedText.excusal: I can't do jury service and would like to be excused
sharedText.deferral: I need to change the date of my jury service
sharedText.govWebsiteText: The GOV.UK website has information to help you prepare for your jury service.
sharedText.contactingHeader: Contacting the Jury Central Summoning Bureau
sharedText.contactingInfoOne: If you have any questions about your jury service, call the Jury Central Summoning Bureau on 0300 456 1024 or email jurysummoning@justice.gov.uk
sharedText.name: Name:

jurorPDF.excusalOne: You have said that you need to
jurorPDF.excusalThree: You have said that you need to
jurorPDF.confirmTwo: do jury service on the date shown.
jurorPDF.excusalTwo: do jury service and would like to be excused.
jurorPDF.jurorDetails: You gave us these juror details
jurorPDF.residencyQuestion: Have you lived in the UK, Channel Islands or Isle of Man for five consecutive years since your 13th birthday?
jurorPDF.mentalHealthSectioned: Are you detained (sectioned) or likely to be detained under the Mental Health Act 1983?
jurorPDF.mentalHealthCapacity: Do you lack capacity as stated in the Mental Capacity Act 2005?
jurorPDF.bailQuestion: Are you currently on bail for a criminal offence?
jurorPDF.convictionsQuestion: Have you been found guilty of a criminal offence?
jurorPDF.dateResponse: You responded to the proposed date of your jury service
jurorPDF.confirmDate: Confirm the date of your jury service
jurorPDF.dateConfirmed: I can do jury service on the date shown
jurorPDF.requireExcusal: I can't do jury service and would like to be excused
jurorPDF.requireDeferral: I need to change the date of my jury service
jurorPDF.excusalDetailsHeader: Because you asked to be excused from jury service, you told us
jurorPDF.deferralDetailsHeader: As you asked to do your jury service on a different date you told us
jurorPDF.excusalReason: Please say why you need to be excused from jury service
jurorPDF.deferralReason: Please explain why you wish to change the date of your jury service
jurorPDF.threeDates: Please give us three dates you could start jury service during the next 12 months.
jurorPDF.employmentHeader: You told us whether you had ever worked for the Criminal Justice System
jurorPDF.employmentQuestion: Now or in the last 5 years, have you worked for the Police Force, HM Prison Service, the National Crime Agency, or any prosecuting authority?
jurorPDF.helpHeader: You told us about any help you'll need in court
jurorPDF.helpDetails: Do you have a disability or impairment that means you'll need extra support or facilities in the court building where you are doing your jury service?
jurorPDF.specialArrangementDetails: Please tell us about any special arrangements or help you need while you're doing jury service.

thirdPartyPDF.jurorDetailsHeader: You gave us these details about the person you're replying for
thirdPartyPDF.thirdPartyDetailsHeader: You're replying for another person called for jury service. You told us this about yourself
thirdPartyPDF.thirdPartyReason: Your reason for replying on behalf of the juror:
thirdPartyPDF.qualifyHeader: You answered the qualifying questions for the person you're replying for
thirdPartyPDF.residencyQuestion: Has the person you're answering for lived in the UK, Channel Islands or Isle of Man for five consecutive years since their 13th birthday?
thirdPartyPDF.mentalHealthSectioned: Is the person detained (sectioned) or likely to be detained under the Mental Health Act 1983?
thirdPartyPDF.mentalHealthCapacity: Does the person lack capacity as stated in the Mental Capacity Act 2005?
thirdPartyPDF.bailQuestion: Is the person on bail for a criminal offence?
thirdPartyPDF.convictionsQuestion: Has the person been found guilty of a criminal offence?
thirdPartyPDF.dateResponseHeader: You responded to the proposed date of the jury service
thirdPartyPDF.confirmDateQuestion: Confirm the date of their jury service
thirdPartyPDF.dateConfirmed: The person I'm answering for can do jury service on the date shown
thirdPartyPDF.requireExcusal: The person I'm answering for can't do jury service and would like to be excused
thirdPartyPDF.requireDeferral: I need to change the date of jury service for the person I'm answering for
thirdPartyPDF.excusalHeader: Because you asked for the person you're replying for to be excused from jury service, you told us
thirdPartyPDF.deferralHeader: As you asked for the person to do jury service on a different date you told us
thirdPartyPDF.excusalReason: Please say why the person needs to be excused from jury service
thirdPartyPDF.deferralReason: Please explain why the person you're replying for wishes to change the date of their jury service
thirdPartyPDF.deferralDates: Please give us three dates the person you're replying for could start jury service during the next 12 months.
thirdPartyPDF.employmentHeader: You told us whether the person had ever worked for the Criminal Justice System
thirdPartyPDF.employmentQuestion: Now or in the last 5 years, has the person worked for the Police Force, HM Prison Service, the National Crime Agency or any prosecuting authority?
thirdPartyPDF.assistanceHeader: You told us about any help the person you're replying for needs in court
thirdPartyPDF.disabilityQuestion: Does the person have a disability or impairment that means they'll need extra support or facilities in the court building where they are doing jury service?
thirdPartyPDF.specialArrangements: Please tell us about any special arrangements or help the person you're answering for needs while they're doing jury service.

deceasedPDF.jurorDeceased: You have said that the person summoned is deceased.
deceasedPDF.nothingElse: You don't need to do anything else.
deceasedPDF.distressApology: Jurors are selected at random from the electoral roll. This isn't always completely up to date. That's why we sent a jury summons to this person. We do apologise for this and hope it hasn't caused too much distress.
deceasedPDF.summoningBureau: Contacting the Jury Central Summoning Bureau
deceasedPDF.contactDetailsOne: If you have any questions about this, call the Jury Central Summoning Bureau on 0300 456 1024 or email jurysummoning@justice.gov.uk

ageIneligiblePDF.ageIneligibleInfo: Your age makes you ineligible to do jury service.
ageIneligiblePDF.pointOne: By law, jurors must be aged 18 - 75. You don't have to do jury service because you are younger than 18 or older than 75.
ageIneligiblePDF.pointTwo: We'll write to confirm that you don't have to do jury service.
ageIneligiblePDF.pointThree: You don't need to do anything else.
ageIneligiblePDF.summoningBureau: Contacting the Jury Central Summoning Bureau
ageIneligiblePDF.anyQuestionsOne: If you have any questions about this, call the Jury Central Summoning Bureau on 0300 456 1024 or email jurysummoning@justice.gov.uk

whatHappensNext.bulletPointOne: a letter confirming the date of your jury service
whatHappensNext.bulletPointTwo:
an information pack about being a juror and
the court you're going to
whatHappensNext.deferralIneligibleLineTwo: We'll also consider whether you can change the date.
whatHappensNext.deferralIneligibleAdjustmentLineTwo: We may also get in touch to talk about the help you need so you can do jury service, and whether you are able to change the date.
whatHappensNext.deferralLastLine: Then, at least two weeks before your jury service starts, we'll send you:
whatHappensNext.deferralLineOne: We'll write to you within the next 7 days to let you know if you can change the date of your jury service.
whatHappensNext.deferralWithAdjustmentLineTwo: If you are able to do jury service, we'll write to you within the next 7 days to let you know if you can change the date.
whatHappensNext.excusalEligibleLineOne: We'll write to you within the next 7 days to let you know if you must do jury service or if you can be excused.
whatHappensNext.excusalIneligibleAdjustmentLineTwo: We may also get in touch to talk about the help you need so you can do jury service, and whether you are able to be excused.
whatHappensNext.excusalIneligibleLineTwo: We'll also consider whether you can be excused.
whatHappensNext.excusalOrDeferralAndIneligibleLineOne: Your answers mean that you might not be able to do jury service. We will now check your answers.
whatHappensNext.excusalWithAdjustmentLineTwo: If you have asked to be excused because of a disability or impairment, we may get in touch to find out more.
whatHappensNext.ifAbleLastLine: If you are able to do jury service, at least two weeks before it starts we'll send you
whatHappensNext.ifMustAssistanceInfo: If you must do jury service, we may get in touch to talk about the help you need to do it.
whatHappensNext.ifMustLastLine: If you must do jury service, at least two weeks before it starts we'll send you:
whatHappensNext.inTouchInSevenDays: We'll be in touch within the next 7 days.
whatHappensNext.straightThroughEligibleNoAdjustment: At least two weeks before your jury service starts, we'll send you:
whatHappensNext.straightThroughIneligibleLineOne: Your answers mean that you might not be able to do jury service.
whatHappensNext.straightThroughIneligibleLineThree: If you can do jury service, at least two weeks before it starts weâ€™ll send you:
whatHappensNext.straightThroughIneligibleLineTwo: We will now check your answers. Then we'll write to you in the next 7 days to let you know if you must or must not do jury service.
whatHappensNext.straightThroughIneligibleWithAdjustmentL: We may also get in touch to talk about the help you need so you can do jury service.
whatHappensNext.straightThroughOrDeferralWithAdjustmentL: We may get in touch to talk about the help you need so you can do jury service.
